By requiring the FAA to expand the definition of ‚Äúmilitary pilot‚Äù to include DoD civilians, I aim to ensure equal treatment of pilots with the same training and qualifications no matter if they serve as a civilian or as an active-duty, reserve, or National Guard pilot.

But, Department of Defense (DoD) civilian pilots do not enjoy that privilege, even though DoD civilian pilots receive the same training and qualifications as their active-duty, reserve, and national guard counterparts.

The benefits have the largest impact on Black non-Hispanic people (reducing their 2021 projected poverty rate 74%)

One big reason for this is the expansion of the Child Tax Credit (CTC), which on its own is estimated to cut child poverty in half. Read more from @JECDems here: https://www.jec.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/democrats/issue-briefs?ID=9F847641-D710-4910-8C38-BDDBDA69FBF2
